poem:
"Call Upon the House"

In our house of many faces,
America, extend your hands,
To distant lands with unknown races. 
I listen, echoing in silent spaces,
Where the tune of urgency stands,
In our house of many faces.

Jeffries' call, the trumpet braces,
The foreign bill's demand expands,
From the house of many faces,
To distant lands with unknown races.
